name: Batla
description: Batla is the awesome shooter game about robots, which came to conquer the Earth, but turned to be were too small for that. They had no choice but to capture the kid's room and start fighting there.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP+ Processor: Core 2 Duo Processor or Equivalent Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB DX9 Compliant DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 2 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible Audio
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP+ Processor: Core i5 or Equivalent Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 512 MB DX9 Compliant DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 2 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible Audio

reviews.review_text: It's basically a bad version of Quake with a shop that has straight upgrades. So basically a bad game of a game no one really cares for to much now a days. Just save your time and just play quake live or any of the f2p shooters basically.   You can buy all in game premium and items with in game currency. I didn't play long enough to figure out if classes were behind a permanent paywall(It appears so although no wiki to confirm that I could find). So you can take a pick between p2w or grind2win as upgrades are just straight upgrades in the shop. It's a mystery how so many can take time to not just either copy a good f2p model or put minimal thought into them.

This game is broken. I can't connect to any of the Russian servers, or the french servers (with Russians in), and even if I do manage to connect, I end up playing for about 10 seconds and then have an unexplained 'connection problem'.  There is bunnyhopping tho

if you are far from russia than you will not be able too play it for more than 20-40 seconds since all of the servers are based in russia and nowhere else. after a few times of loading the game it would often freeze and crash or not even show the menu   overall the game is bassically unplayable but i like the consept for it, just needs a few updates and fixes because at the moment is VERY broken and unplayable   also fast paced and hard to play

Only play if you like unfair matches, you either end up with a unfair team balance or a server with no players but you. Seriously, go and get Team Fortress 2. The game is free and the game works smoothly (Not like Batla (a.k.a Altab)). I mean, who bothers to make a name by reversing Altab? That's incredibly lazy. Why could be like Toy Warfare? I say that's a better name and I came up with that within 10 seconds. If you really want to play this game, make a private game and invite your friends. I had a whale of a time with my other friend (Yes, only one friend and I had the time of my life playing with him. Want to know why? Because it was FAIR) I rate the game 3/10. Needs more improvements before it can be a game worth the time. But for now, stay clear of this game. Such a bad example for Steam.
Quake Kid Edition

A cartoonish take on the classic arena shooter.  -Pros 1 Nice style 2 Runs great  -Cons 1 Horribly unbalanced 2 Pay2Win 3 Bad spawnpoints 4 No team balancing  It is horrible, uninstall it and go ahead and play the new FREE Unreal Tournament. UT may be unfinished but way better.
The various baby building blocks in every level should be a sign that this game was made for 10 year old squeakers to play call of duty together.  Think brickforce but with robot's.
This is a very bad game.This game destroys friendship and the DLC is a waste of your money.I don't recomand it.

Perfect on Windows. Absolutely no problem! Then went to use it on my Linux Mint machine (which is my main gaming machine) and it said it downloaded instantly, but had no exicutables, so I went into my folder, and saw that it didnt download ANYTHING it just gave me an empty folder. And now before I get ♥♥♥♥, Mint is run off the Ubuntu repos. so there would be absolutely no problem gaming on it. Mint is just a better looking version of ubuntu with a few tweaks! Please Fix I really enjoy this game :/

Interesting...  It's a good concept for a game executed fairly well. It runs extremeley fast but the servers are practically dead. There was noone online. In roughly 35 minutes of gameplay the most people in the ONLY game at the time (mine) was 4 people. Effectiveley, It's a good game but good luck finding people to play it with.   P.S. This game is a blast with friends!

Batla is a pretty cool First Person Shooter. But I can't help but feel like it took some inspiration from Team Fortress 2.
Quite fun game with cartoony-look Gameplay, Should you play it? Yes!  Overall 7/10 (voted as a F2P game)

Its a cute game. Well executed. However, small number of variant classes and parts for your invading toy sized robots, and sparse, unpopulated maps.  If you like this, then you will LOVE Gear Up. Thats a little more grownup version of this game, that has more people playing it.
dis game is lots of fun but its lot of russians
This is an amazing fun game, I read some of the bad comments and I totally disagree. This game is fun and a great game to play with friends and family! I would definitely recommend this game.

You can ignore the childish themes Because the gameplay reminds me Of TF2 Of the fast paste movment during the gameplay Im loving it... Beside the fact that people one hit you even with maxed out armour stats

READ THIS REVIEW!!!! There are loads of people saying that this game is awful, but I think it is very fun! It appeals more to the younger audience (like me) and is great fun. I recommend buying the starter pack as it gives you the upper hand in equal battles! I have bought all the DLC and still find better players rekking me (I'm bad) despite my advantage. It is basically a version on TF2 for younger children!
It doesnt look like it would be very appealing, but personally I really like it! 10/potatoes ^_^
This game is alright. Fun and simple but not enough people play it. It's a shooter but when I join a server it has like 2 people in it. Everyone should play this because everyone would enjoy it!
It would be good, if I could find people to play with... 5/10

This game can be seen as the worst way for anyone to have redone Quake Live. There is almost no effort put into it. This game feels like a cheaply done Google Play/ IPod game, DO NOT PUT ANY MONEY INTO THIS GAME.

Its fun, free, fast, casual, worth a try.

This isn't the best game that I've played, but I still like its theme and plotline. The controls are pretty straightforward ( WASD to move, mouse to look around/aim, left click to shoot, reight click to zoom in). The maps are very innovative with the giant kid's bedroom vibe. I also like the robotic character designs and the DLC modifications, and the variety of weapons is a nice addition too. All in all, Batla is a very simply designed and fun First Person Shooter! Nicely done!
The funniest small free to play game

(English) I write now to you the pros of this game: 1.Graphics 2.Huge selection of weapons 3.Opportunities to upgrade 4.Really cool card 5.Especially do not need to spend money on the donut. 7/10  (Русский) Сейчас я напишу вам плюсы этой игры: 1.Графика 2.Огромный выбор оружия 3.Возможности для модернизации 4.Очень классная карта 5.Особенно не нужно тратить деньги на донат. 7/10

It could be a good game, but it's not. The game is just a stupid, childish, pay to win version of Quake III: Arena. Users with higher level or with bought dlc have much more health and couse much more damage than you (pay to win). Also, there's a lot of (mainly russian/turkish) cheaters. In one match I did not know why my weapons damage 0 and why are they killing me instantly. Well, they were 20+ levels above and were cheaters too (they already had (one or more) VAC-ban). I can't recommend this game, stay away. Even if it's 'free', you have no chance against paid users. Oh, and about 30 people plays this now and about 20 of them are cheaters...
Its really fun once you spend a few hundered dollars.
